div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1593 Ras-Baalbek, c. 35 km. NE of Baal- bek, Coelesyria, 1957 Burial: c. 140 B.C. (Westermark) Contents: 43 AR Athens: 2 New Style tetradr. Aegae: 1 tetradr. (as BMC 9) Cyme: 3 tetradr. (as BMC 77, 80) Myrina: 1 tetradr. (as BMC 9-10) Magnesia: 7 tetradr. (as BMC 36-37 and var.) Smyrna: 1 tetradr. (as BMC 3 var.) Demetrius 1: 9 tetradr. (Antiocheia to yr. 162) Alexander I: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia, as SMA 167) Demetrius II: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia, yr. 168) Ptolemy VI: 17 didr. (unc. mint, yrs. 115-7; as Svoronos 1224-7) Disposition: dispersed Thompson, Athens, p. 523 (= Zahle) Seyrig, Tr√©sors du Levant (in press) For the dating of the Ptol. didr. cf. Newell, Standard Ptol. Silver. The find was formerly known as the Zahle hd.
